intro: Psychotria cerronis, commonly known as the Amazonian Psychotria, is a flowering plant native to the rainforests of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves and clusters of white or pale pink flowers. The plant produces small, round berries that are typically green when immature and turn red when ripe. It is often found growing in the understory of tropical forests, thriving in humid and shaded environments. Psychotria cerronis is also noted for its potential ethnobotanical uses, though its medicinal properties remain under study.
